article_title: Auto Insurers' Marriage Discount Faces Scrutiny
article_text:
Are married people better drivers? Insurance companies think so, and most have long charged married drivers less than single ones, which can amount to hundreds of dollars a year in savings.

Now same-sex couples, gay-rights advocates and a new federal agency are pushing states to take a closer look at the appropriateness of discounts enjoyed by married heterosexual couples but not gay ones. The practice can also disadvantage longtime...

twitter.title: Auto Insurers' Marriage Discount Faces Scrutiny

image.alt: Auto insurers' marriage discount faces scrutiny, calls to consider fairness by gay-rights advocates, others
